value:
Not long ago, I met the first foreigner
my people had seen in 800 years.
Now, it seems I'm the traveler.

There is a kind of peace in the cruelty
of the desert. When basic survival is a
struggle, conflicts are set aside.

Lonely, are you? Well, don't look to
me for comfort. Hah! You should see
your face. Have I offended you?

I am still learning to tell which fruits
here are poisonous. Would you mind
giving me some advice?

I yearn for the warm desert wind.
The air here is cold and clammy
by comparison.

I am Nailah, a visitor from your friend
$Nf. You have
nothing to fear from me.

Let all who fall under my gaze be
paralyzed by fear!

Even the most vicious predator must
put away the fangs now and then.

A moment of weakness, but my foes
will learn I've strength to spare.

A new technique? Good. Stand back
and watch how I use it.

I am Nailah, Queen of the desert
nation of Hatari. Yes, I am missing
an eye. Gawk and you'll lose yours.

Something is troubling you—I can tell
by your face. I will lend you an ear.
Go on, speak.$k$pI see. You lack the strength to take
the field yourself, and you fret for the
ones you send to battle in your stead.$k$pListen, $Nu.
Everyone has a purpose. Take heart
knowing you have found yours.$k$pMy companion is the same. He too
lacks the strength for battle, but his
beauty and kindness bring me peace.$k$pBeorc live short lives—focus on what
you can do rather than what you
can't, and yours will be free of regret.
はぁっ！
いくぞ
うああっ！
Not bad...!
Let's have a little fun.
I'm your opponent.
Not bad.
I'll dye my fangs red.
I should not have been so cocky...
(sigh)
I am Nailah, queen of Hatari.
It seems you're looking to lose a finger or two.
Beorc of another world, I've been itching to test your mettle.
Did I hear you mention the name Ike, the beorc hero? I have taken an interest in his swordsmanship.
Save your concern. I am well. I do thank you for the thought, however.
So many strong fighters gathered from across the realms... It seems I won't be bored here.
Listen to me. You must not die. Hang on one hour at a time--just don't let go.
Right.
I'm more than ready.
Together.
